title: Kemarit
author: Kemarit
content: https://x.com/le_Parisien/status/1882393967695708449This could be the biggest physical attacks on a crypto personalities as it was reported that David Belland, co-founder of Ledger wallet was kidnapped in France, but he was released. Reports are still sketchy by this time, not sure if they paid ransom or what.

Kidnap someone is never a good action of any person or group of people.Ledger Recovery - Send your (encrypted) recovery phrase to 3rd parties entitiesThere are many Bitcoin physical attacks but this one can be one of most famous or biggest case.https://github.com/demining/Physical-Bitcoin-Attackshttps://github.com/jlopp/physical-bitcoin-attacks

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: UchihaSarada on January 23, 2025, 12:51:11 PMThere are many Bitcoin physical attacks but this one can be one of most famous or biggest case.https://github.com/demining/Physical-Bitcoin-Attackshttps://github.com/jlopp/physical-bitcoin-attacksThere are so many of them. While some of have been lucky to not be killed in the process but only had their bitcoins stolen, others have lost their lives and injured. He has been freed according to reports from BloombergQuoteA co-founder of French crypto wallet startup Ledger SAS who was kidnapped in central France has been released, the Paris prosecutor’s office said in a statement. David Balland was taken from his home in the early hours of Tuesday and freed on Wednesday night after a police operation. The criminals demanded the payment of a substantial ransom in cryptocurrency, the prosecutor’s office said.I don't know if he paid any ransom or not but his release comes as a great news.

comments.author: bakasabo
comments.body: Did kidnapers know who they were kidnapping? I wish to know what was their plan. Kidnap David Belland and ask for money directly from him, thinking that he is rich and hold all the funds people store using ledger. Or wanted to get access to database with seed phrases (which is silly, as ledger dont store them)?

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.created_time: January 23, 2025, 09:42:07 PMLast edit: January 23, 2025, 10:07:11 PM by Saint-loup
comments.body: Actually his wife had also been kidnapped with him, and she has been released today without being hurt. The ransom had been partialy paid but "Nearly all of these cryptocurrencies were traced, frozen, and seized" according to a magistrate in charge of the case. The criminals demanded several millions of euros in cryptocurrencies to other Ledger associates. 10 of them had been arrested by the police, 9 men and one women, aged between 20 and 40 years old.

The criminals demanded several millions of euros in cryptocurrencies to other Ledger associates. 10 of them had been arrested by the police, 9 men and one women, aged between 20 and 40 years old.Ok, I thought that this is a whole setup or something because in the beginning, there are no source buy French news and twitter and there could be something lost in the translation. So thanks for confirming as I assumed you are French.But I don't know, there are funny comments in other community that our Ledger might be compromised.I don't think that will be the case though, our wallet will still be safe as we have total control of it and not the co-founder.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: I will be keeping an eye on any investigations surrounding this - I have read so many stories of Ledgers being magically "hacked" when their main purpose was as a security solution, so I can't help but wonder if a victim of one of these hacks was behind this. Just a few weeks ago someone on X was posting about how they lost 5+ BTC that was stored in a ledger. Of course though, no one deserves to be kidnapped and kidnapping is no way to profit (nor recover losses), and I hope David can recover, move on, and keep himself safe going forward.

comments.body: This is one more example of a bitcoin physical attack.As such, Jameson Lopp has included it in his list of physical bitcoin attacks.Luckily he was released, but unfortunately most of the time, people don't get released and are beaten hard.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: It was very bad for him to find himself in such a chaotic situation, but that's the risk for people who hold cryptocurrency assets when their identities are known to the public, they just don't know when there will be danger that will target them in public. Because this is not the first time a famous person in the crypto industry has been kidnapped in public, in my city alone there was a bitcoin millionaire from Russia who was kidnapped and had to lose his assets. This is one of the reasons why it is important to maintain identity or protect yourself when in public, we just don't know when a bad day will happen to us.

comments.body: The good thing is that David and his wife is already safe, although reports says that his hands or maybe it was just a finger was mutilated.It was already reported that they have paid the ransom in crypto, has been traced and frozen. And 10 people has been questioned already the authorities.QuoteMr David Balland, a co-founder of French crypto firm Ledger, had his hand mutilated while he and his wife were kidnapped, the Paris prosecutor said, adding that 10 people were being questioned following the freeing of the pair.Mr Balland was taken to hospital and treated for injuries to one of his hands, she said, without giving details.As of Jan 23, 10 people, most of them already known to police, were being questioned by the police, the prosecutor said.
